title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0149

segments.en: Hello everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Catherine.
So Marco, today we're talking about rent and housing.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，今天我们要谈论租房和住房。

segments.en: Right, we're actually going to be moving.
We're going to be going to a new apartment or a new house.
segments.cn: 我们要去一个新公寓或新房子。

segments.en: And so we're going to look at all the words related to this because sometimes it can be a real hassle, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们要看看与此相关的所有词汇，因为有时这真的很麻烦，对吧？

segments.en: It can be really difficult.
Absolutely.
Well, you love moving, right?
You were telling me how much you love moving your stuff and negotiating a new lease.
segments.cn: 你跟我说过你有多喜欢搬东西和谈判新租约。

segments.en: Well, I like the negotiation of the lease, but not the moving aspect.
segments.cn: 嗯，我喜欢谈判租约，但不喜欢搬家的过程。

segments.en: No, I don't think anyone likes moving.
segments.cn: 不，我觉得没有人喜欢搬家。

segments.en: Actually, I do like it at times because then you can just throw away so many things that you have no need for and you wouldn't throw away unless you moved.
segments.cn: 其实，有时候我喜欢，因为你可以扔掉很多不需要的东西，除非你搬家，否则你不会扔掉。

segments.en: So let's go check out today's dialogue to find out what happens to the characters.
segments.cn: 那我们来看看今天的对话，看看角色们发生了什么。

segments.en: Okay, that's fine.
Bye.
What happened?
That's it.
My lease is up.
I have to move.
What?
Why?
Can't you renew it?
The owner apparently is selling this place to make way for the construction of a parking lot.
segments.cn: 房东显然要卖掉这个地方，以便建设停车场。

segments.en: Well, I can help you pack.
We should start looking for a new place for you ASAP.
segments.cn: 我们应该尽快开始为你找新地方。

segments.en: I think I might move in with my parents for a couple of months until I can find something.
segments.cn: 我想我可能会和我父母住几个月，直到我找到合适的地方。

segments.en: You know how hard it is to find a decent place around here.
segments.cn: 你知道在这里找到一个体面的地方有多难。

segments.en: I'm going to have to put most of my stuff in storage for a while.
segments.cn: 我得把大部分东西存放一段时间。

segments.en: Well, let me know if there's anything I can do to help out.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果有我能帮忙的，请告诉我。

segments.en: Actually, would you mind looking after my pet tarantula and snake for a couple of weeks?
segments.cn: 其实，你能照顾我的宠物狼蛛和蛇几周吗？

segments.en: Sure.
Alright, we're back.
So, well, it's not much of a big deal.
segments.cn: 所以，这没什么大不了的。

segments.en: I guess if you have your parents nearby you can just move back in with your parents.
segments.cn: 我想如果你父母在附近，你可以搬回去。

segments.en: Easier said than done.
True, true.
We'll get to that in a little bit.
But let's take a look at the words that are used today in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 但让我们看看今天在语言收获中使用的词汇。

segments.en: Alright, so this first one is an important one because generally when you're looking for a house or an apartment, there are two things you can do.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个词很重要，因为通常当你在找房子或公寓时，你可以做两件事。

segments.en: You can buy a house or you can lease a house or apartment.
segments.cn: 你可以买房子，或者你可以租房子或公寓。

segments.en: So, lease here, Marco.
It's basically to rent, right?
It's a contract where you agree to pay a monthly or a quarterly fee for using that house or apartment.
segments.cn: 这是一份合同，你同意支付每月或每季度的费用来使用那栋房子或公寓。

segments.en: So do you own your apartment or do you lease it?
segments.cn: 那你是拥有你的公寓，还是租的？

segments.en: No, I don't mind.
I lease.
I am not a home owner yet.
Right, so owning a home is a lot more expensive at one kind of period where you have to just pay in and you have maybe a mortgage.
segments.cn: 对，所以拥有房子在某种程度上要贵得多，你可能需要支付抵押贷款。

segments.en: But leasing is just a monthly fee, like you said.
segments.cn: 但租赁只是每月的费用，就像你说的。

segments.en: So in this case they had to leave because their lease was expired.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，他们不得不离开，因为他们的租约到期了。

segments.en: Exactly.
So you can, at the end of a lease, do one of two things.
segments.cn: 所以在租约结束时，你可以做两件事。

segments.en: You can stop and you can find a new apartment or you can renew your lease.
segments.cn: 你可以停止，找到一个新公寓，或者你可以续租。

segments.en: Alright, and that's our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: To renew your lease basically means to... To continue.
segments.cn: 续租基本上意味着……继续。

segments.en: To continue.
And this is actually a good word because it can be used with any contract because really a lease is a kind of contract.
segments.cn: 这是一个好词，因为它可以用于任何合同，因为租约实际上是一种合同。

segments.en: And so I can say, I renewed my job contract.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，我续签了我的工作合同。

segments.en: Or maybe a magazine subscription.
You renewed your magazine subscription.
segments.cn: 你续订了你的杂志订阅。

segments.en: It's a way of saying that you've committed to paying for the next six months or one year.
segments.cn: 这是一种说法，表示你承诺支付接下来的六个月或一年。

segments.en: Okay.
Well, and after that, as we said, the person decided to move in with the parents.
segments.cn: 好吧，之后，正如我们所说，那个人决定和父母住。

segments.en: So move in.
Move in.
Well, we can say he moved his car.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们可以说他把车移走了。

segments.en: He put it in a different place.
segments.cn: 他把它放在了不同的地方。

segments.en: But to move in is actually to change houses or to change apartments.
segments.cn: 但搬进来实际上是指换房子或换公寓。

segments.en: And you're literally moving your things and you're moving your clothes and you're moving into a new home.
segments.cn: 你实际上是在搬运你的东西、衣物，搬进一个新家。

segments.en: So you're living in a new place.
segments.cn: 所以你住在一个新地方。

segments.en: So in this case, this person is going to live with the parents.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，这个人要和父母住。

segments.en: Move in.
Alright.
And our next word is when you have to move, you have to pack.
segments.cn: 我们下一个词是当你必须搬家时，你必须打包。

segments.en: Okay, so you can pack a lot of things.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以打包很多东西。

segments.en: In this case, you're packing a box with all of your belongings.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你正在打包一个装有你所有物品的箱子。

segments.en: Your books and your pillows and all that.
But you can also pack a suitcase or you can pack luggage.
segments.cn: 但你也可以打包一个手提箱或行李。

segments.en: So packing is putting things into something so that you can move them.
segments.cn: 所以打包是把东西放进某个东西里，以便你可以搬运它们。

segments.en: So you can carry them or take them somewhere.
segments.cn: 这样你就可以携带或把它们带到某个地方。

segments.en: Exactly.
So in this case, you have to pack your things, put them in boxes to take them to your new home.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，你必须打包你的东西，把它们放进箱子里，带到你的新家。

segments.en: And our last word is an acronym when you said ASAP.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个词是一个缩写，当你说ASAP时。

segments.en: Alright.
Snap, snap.
Come on.
ASAP, Marco.
Describe this for us quickly.
Alright.
So ASAP is an acronym for as soon as possible.
Okay, so you often see this in the office on envelopes or emails.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你经常在办公室的信封或电子邮件上看到这个。

segments.en: Right.
So please respond ASAP.
ASAP.
This means please respond right away.
As soon as you can.
As soon as possible.
Alright.
So five great words that we've just taken a look at.
segments.cn: 所以我们刚刚看过的五个很棒的词。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue again and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话，我们马上回来。

segments.en: Okay.
That's fine.
Bye.
What happened?
That's it.
My lease is up.
I have to move.
What?
Why?
Can't you renew it?
The owner apparently is selling this place to make way for the construction of a parking lot.
segments.cn: 房东显然是要卖掉这个地方，以便为停车场的建设让路。

segments.en: Well, I can help you pack.
We should start looking for a new place for you ASAP.
segments.cn: 我们应该尽快开始为你找新地方。

segments.en: I think I might move in with my parents for a couple of months until I can find something.
segments.cn: 我想我可能会和我父母住几个月，直到我找到合适的地方。

segments.en: You know how hard it is to find a decent place around here.
segments.cn: 你知道在这里找到一个体面的地方有多难。

segments.en: I'm going to have to put most of my stuff in storage for a while.
segments.cn: 我得把大部分东西暂时放在储物间。

segments.en: Well, let me know if there's anything I can do to help out.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果有我能帮忙的，请告诉我。

segments.en: Actually, would you mind looking after my pet tarantula and snake for a couple of weeks?
segments.cn: 其实，你介意照顾我的宠物狼蛛和蛇几周吗？

segments.en: Uh, sure.
Alright, we're back and we have a couple of different phrases for you.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了，有几个不同的短语给你。

segments.en: So, let's look at those now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在流利度构建器中看看这些。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Our first one is a little bit unusual.
segments.cn: 流利度构建器 我们的第一个短语有点不寻常。

segments.en: We heard the phrase, my lease is up.
segments.cn: 我们听到了短语，我的租约到期了。

segments.en: So, Marco, let's talk about this phrase, to be up.
segments.cn: 所以，Marco，让我们谈谈这个短语，to be up。

segments.en: Alright, so if something is up, as in this case the lease, it means it's expired, it's finished.
segments.cn: 好的，如果某件事情到期了，比如租约，意味着它已经过期，结束了。

segments.en: So, it's over.
You can also say, our time is up.
segments.cn: 你也可以说，我们的时间到了。

segments.en: Right, if we have a meeting.
So, that's all the time I have.
Time to go away.
Time is up.
Very good.
So, it's always related to time or maybe a contract, as in this case, your lease is up.
segments.cn: 所以，它总是与时间或合同有关，就像在这种情况下，你的租约到期了。

segments.en: So, it means over or finished.
segments.cn: 所以，它意味着结束或完成。

segments.en: Alright, so moving on to our second phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来是我们的第二个短语。

segments.en: To make way for.
Alright, so this is a great one.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个很好的短语。

segments.en: This often makes me think of kings and queens in the old days.
segments.cn: 这常常让我想起古代的国王和女王。

segments.en: They say, make way for the king.
So, you have to... Get out of the way.
Yeah, get out of the way or to clear some space for them to move because there's too much stuff in the way.
segments.cn: 是的，让开，或者为他们腾出一些空间，因为路上有太多东西。

segments.en: And so, in this case, the owner of the apartment, what the guy was living in, is trying to make some space or make way for a parking lot.
segments.cn: 所以，在这种情况下，公寓的房东，那个住在里面的人，试图腾出一些空间或为停车场让路。

segments.en: Right, so he's basically going to sell the building or house and build a parking lot instead.
segments.cn: 对，所以他基本上要卖掉这栋楼或房子，改建成停车场。

segments.en: So, they are making way for the new parking lot.
segments.cn: 所以，他们正在为新的停车场让路。

segments.en: They're clearing space.
And this is actually really sad because my childhood home, they destroyed to make way for a larger, ugly, big house.
segments.cn: 这实际上真的很悲伤，因为我童年的家被毁了，以便为一个更大、更丑的房子让路。

segments.en: Really?
See, it happens all the time.
Now they're making way for malls and big buildings and all of their little houses are destroyed.
segments.cn: 现在他们在为购物中心和大楼让路，所有的小房子都被毁了。

segments.en: And, well, moving on to our last phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，接下来是我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: The person asked the friend if he would mind looking after the pet snake and tarantula.
segments.cn: 这个人问朋友是否介意照顾宠物蛇和狼蛛。

segments.en: I would mind.
You don't like snakes or tarantulas?
Well, I don't mind them as long as I don't live with them.
segments.cn: 嗯，只要我不和它们住在一起，我不介意。

segments.en: So, would you mind?
This is a nice way to start a sentence if you want to ask for a favor, right?
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的方式来开始一个句子，如果你想请求一个帮忙，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
So, here's an alternative.
segments.cn: 所以，这里有一个替代方案。

segments.en: Hey, Marco, can you do this for me?
I could, maybe.
I could say, Marco, would you mind doing this for me?
segments.cn: 我可以说，Marco，你介意帮我这个忙吗？

segments.en: It's more polite.
It is more polite and it's a little bit gentler.
segments.cn: 这更礼貌，也稍微温和一些。

segments.en: So, it's a nice way of asking someone for a favor.
segments.cn: 所以，这是请求别人帮忙的好方式。

segments.en: Exactly.
And that's why this is funny.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么这很有趣。

segments.en: Because the favor is not like, would you mind watching my kitty?
segments.cn: 因为这个请求并不是，您介意照看我的小猫吗？

segments.en: The favor is, would you mind watching my poisonous pets?
segments.cn: 这个请求是，您介意照看我的有毒宠物吗？

segments.en: Right.
Alright, so, would you mind?
But, in the end, the person agreed.
So, it works, right?
It does work.
So, would you mind... So, listeners, would you mind listening to today's dialogue one more time at its normal speed before we come back to you and talk more about renting an apartment?
segments.cn: 所以，你介意... 所以，听众，你介意再听一遍今天的对话，以正常速度吗？在我们回来和你谈谈租公寓的事情之前。

segments.en: Okay, that's fine.
Bye.
What happened?
That's it.
My lease is up.
I have to move.
What?
Why?
Can't you renew it?
The owner apparently is selling this place to make way for the construction of a parking lot.
segments.cn: 房东显然是要卖掉这个地方，以便为停车场的建设让路。

segments.en: Well, I can help you pack.
We should start looking for a new place for you ASAP.
segments.cn: 我们应该尽快开始为你找新地方。

segments.en: I think I might move in with my parents for a couple of months until I can find something.
segments.cn: 我想我可能会和我父母住几个月，直到我找到合适的地方。

segments.en: You know how hard it is to find a decent place around here.
segments.cn: 你知道在这里找到一个体面的地方有多难。

segments.en: I'm going to have to put most of my stuff in storage for a while.
segments.cn: 我得把大部分东西暂时放在储物间。

segments.en: Well, let me know if there's anything I can do to help out.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果有我能帮忙的，请告诉我。

segments.en: Actually, would you mind looking after my pet tarantula and snake for a couple of weeks?
segments.cn: 其实，你介意照顾我的宠物狼蛛和蛇几周吗？

segments.en: Sure.
Alright, so moving in.
Now, you have different stages in your life, right?
segments.cn: 现在，你的人生阶段不同，对吧？

segments.en: When you move out, for example, you move out of your parents' home and you live on your own and then maybe, like in this case, you would move back in with your parents.
segments.cn: 比如，当你搬出去时，你是从父母家搬出去，自己生活，然后可能像这种情况一样，再搬回父母家。

segments.en: How do you see that happening?
I see it very often.
segments.cn: 我看到这种情况很常见。

segments.en: My brother just moved back in with my parents.
Yeah, I think that it depends on the person, honestly.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这取决于个人，老实说。

segments.en: I mean, especially because the economy has really been suffering for the last year.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，尤其是因为经济在过去一年里真的很糟糕。

segments.en: A lot of people are doing this because, you know, in a lot of cities in America, you can spend $1,000 to $2,000 a month for an apartment to rent.
segments.cn: 很多人这样做，因为你知道，在美国很多城市，租一个公寓每月要花1000到2000美元。

segments.en: And that's a small apartment or a shared apartment.
segments.cn: 而且那是一个小公寓或合租公寓。

segments.en: And so, I understand this is a really... Well, it's a better option now than it was before because everyone wants independence.
segments.cn: 所以，我理解这现在是一个更好的选择，因为每个人都想要独立。

segments.en: But sometimes you just can't afford it.
segments.cn: 但有时你就是负担不起。

segments.en: Exactly.
And it's a cultural thing because some people move out of their parents' home, maybe for college.
segments.cn: 这也是一种文化现象，因为有些人可能为了上大学而搬出父母家。

segments.en: It's very common in the U.S.
to study in another city or another state, right?
segments.cn: 在另一个城市或州上学，对吧？

segments.en: But then maybe coming back home and moving in with your parents, or in other cultures, maybe they don't move out at all.
segments.cn: 但然后可能又回家，和父母住在一起，或者在其他文化中，他们可能根本不搬出去。

segments.en: Maybe they only move out once they're married.
segments.cn: 也许他们只有在结婚后才搬出去。

segments.en: Exactly.
So a lot of people in China, I think in Shanghai specifically, don't move out of their parents' home until they're going to get married.
segments.cn: 所以我认为在中国，特别是上海，很多人直到要结婚才会搬出父母家。

segments.en: Right.

And it does make sense in many big Metropolis because, as you say, rent is expensive, living on your own is expensive, and you don't have anyone to share those costs with, like gas, water, electricity, even food, right?
segments.cn: 在许多大城市中这确实有道理，因为正如你所说，租金昂贵，独自生活也很贵，而且你没有人来分担这些费用，比如燃气、水、电，甚至食物，对吧？

segments.en: It's cheaper among more people.
And not to mention a little bit scary living on your own for the first time.
segments.cn: 更不用说第一次独自生活有点可怕。

segments.en: It is a little bit scary.
What about having somebody move in with you, maybe a roommate or a girlfriend or boyfriend?
segments.cn: 那么，和别人一起住呢，可能是室友或女朋友/男朋友？

segments.en: Oh, that's always the big step.
The big commitment?
The big commitment.
You're in a relationship and you ask your partner to move in with you.
segments.cn: 你在一段关系中，问你的伴侣是否愿意和你同住。

segments.en: So, yeah, the step before marriage, I guess.
segments.cn: 所以，是的，我想这是婚前的步骤。

segments.en: Wow.
There's nothing before that?
Nothing before marriage?
No.
That's pretty much it.
You tell me.
I don't know.
All right.
That's all the time we have for today.
But be sure to come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 但一定要访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: If you have any questions or any comments about this topic, we would be glad to have your input on it.
segments.cn: 如果你对这个话题有任何问题或评论，我们很乐意听取你的意见。

segments.en: And we'll see you guys there.
And if you have any suggestions for the step before the step before marriage, please let us know because we're in the dark on this one.
segments.cn: 如果你对婚前的步骤有任何建议，请告诉我们，因为我们对此一无所知。

segments.en: So, until next time.
Bye, everyone.
